name: PlayFab Postman SDK 0.60.180705
description:
PlayFab API SDK for Postman.

This is still under development, and is not yet ready for general use.  Experienced users can utilize this if they carefully examine the post-body and ensure the data is properly entered.  By default, the post-body is NOT defaulting to useable values.

requests.name: AbortTaskInstance
requests.description:
Abort an ongoing task instance.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/AbortTaskInstance

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"TaskInstanceId": ID of a task instance that is being aborted.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: AddNews
requests.description:
Adds a new news item to the title's news feed

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/AddNews

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Body": Body text of the news

"Timestamp": Time this news was published. If not set, defaults to now.

"Title": Title (headline) of the news item

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: AddServerBuild
requests.description:
Adds the game server executable specified (previously uploaded - see GetServerBuildUploadUrl) to the set of those a client is permitted to request in a call to StartGame

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/AddServerBuild

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"ActiveRegions": server host regions in which this build should be running and available

"BuildId": unique identifier for the build executable

"CommandLineTemplate": appended to the end of the command line when starting game servers

"Comment": developer comment(s) for this build

"ExecutablePath": path to the game server executable. Defaults to gameserver.exe

"MaxGamesPerHost": maximum number of game server instances that can run on a single host machine

"MinFreeGameSlots": minimum capacity of additional game server instances that can be started before the autoscaling service starts new host machines (given the number of current running host machines and game server instances)

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: AddUserVirtualCurrency
requests.description:
Increments the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/AddUserVirtualCurrency

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Amount": Amount to be added to the user balance of the specified virtual currency. Maximum VC balance is Int32 (2,147,483,647). Any increase over this value will be discarded.

"PlayFabId": PlayFab unique identifier of the user whose virtual currency balance is to be increased.

"VirtualCurrency": Name of the virtual currency which is to be incremented.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: CreateActionsOnPlayersInSegmentTask
requests.description:
Create an ActionsOnPlayersInSegment task, which iterates through all players in a segment to execute action.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/CreateActionsOnPlayersInSegmentTask

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Description": Description the task

"IsActive": Whether the schedule is active. Inactive schedule will not trigger task execution.

"Name": Name of the task. This is a unique identifier for tasks in the title.

"Parameter": Task details related to segment and action

"Schedule": Cron expression for the run schedule of the task. The expression should be in UTC.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: GetContentUploadUrl
requests.description:
Retrieves the pre-signed URL for uploading a content file. A subsequent HTTP PUT to the returned URL uploads the content. Also, please be aware that the Content service is specifically PlayFab's CDN offering, for which standard CDN rates apply.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/GetContentUploadUrl

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"ContentType": A standard MIME type describing the format of the contents. The same MIME type has to be set in the header when uploading the content. If not specified, the MIME type is 'binary/octet-stream' by default.

"Key": Key of the content item to upload, usually formatted as a path, e.g. images/a.png

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: GetPlayersInSegment
requests.description:
Allows for paging through all players in a given segment. This API creates a snapshot of all player profiles that match the segment definition at the time of its creation and lives through the Total Seconds to Live, refreshing its life span on each subsequent use of the Continuation Token. Profiles that change during the course of paging will not be reflected in the results. AB Test segments are currently not supported by this operation.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/GetPlayersInSegment

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"ContinuationToken": Continuation token if retrieving subsequent pages of results.

"MaxBatchSize": Maximum number of profiles to load. Default is 1,000. Maximum is 10,000.

"SecondsToLive": Number of seconds to keep the continuation token active. After token expiration it is not possible to continue paging results. Default is 300 (5 minutes). Maximum is 1,800 (30 minutes).

"SegmentId": Unique identifier for this segment.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: ModifyServerBuild
requests.description:
Updates the build details for the specified game server executable

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/ModifyServerBuild

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"ActiveRegions": array of regions where this build can used, when it is active

"BuildId": unique identifier of the previously uploaded build executable to be updated

"CommandLineTemplate": appended to the end of the command line when starting game servers

"Comment": developer comment(s) for this build

"ExecutablePath": path to the game server executable. Defaults to gameserver.exe

"MaxGamesPerHost": maximum number of game server instances that can run on a single host machine

"MinFreeGameSlots": minimum capacity of additional game server instances that can be started before the autoscaling service starts new host machines (given the number of current running host machines and game server instances)

"Timestamp": new timestamp

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: ResolvePurchaseDispute

requests.name: SetupPushNotification
requests.description:
Sets the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for iOS and Android push notifications. Documentation on the exact restrictions can be found at: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/api/API_CreatePlatformApplication.html. Currently, Amazon device Messaging is not supported.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Admin/method/SetupPushNotification

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Credential": Credential is the Private Key for APNS/APNS_SANDBOX, and the API Key for GCM

"Key": for APNS, this is the PlatformPrincipal (SSL Certificate)

"Name": name of the application sending the message (application names must be made up of only uppercase and lowercase ASCII letters, numbers, underscores, hyphens, and periods, and must be between 1 and 256 characters long)

"OverwriteOldARN": replace any existing ARN with the newly generated one. If this is set to false, an error will be returned if notifications have already setup for this platform.

"Platform": supported notification platforms are Apple Push Notification Service (APNS and APNS_SANDBOX) for iOS and Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) for Android

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

"Permission": Permission to be applied to all user data keys written in this request. Defaults to "private" if not set.

"PlayFabId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

requests.name: AcceptTrade
requests.description:
Accepts an open trade (one that has not yet been accepted or cancelled), if the locally signed-in player is in the allowed player list for the trade, or it is open to all players. If the call is successful, the offered and accepted items will be swapped between the two players' inventories.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"AcceptedInventoryInstanceIds": Items from the accepting player's inventory in exchange for the offered items in the trade. In the case of a gift, this will be null.

"OfferingPlayerId": Player who opened the trade.

"TradeId": Trade identifier.

requests.name: ExecuteCloudScript
requests.description:
Executes a CloudScript function, with the 'currentPlayerId' set to the PlayFab ID of the authenticated player.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/ExecuteCloudScript

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"FunctionName": The name of the CloudScript function to execute

"FunctionParameter": Object that is passed in to the function as the first argument

"GeneratePlayStreamEvent": Generate a 'player_executed_cloudscript' PlayStream event containing the results of the function execution and other contextual information. This event will show up in the PlayStream debugger console for the player in Game Manager.

"RevisionSelection": Option for which revision of the CloudScript to execute. 'Latest' executes the most recently created revision, 'Live' executes the current live, published revision, and 'Specific' executes the specified revision. The default value is 'Specific', if the SpeificRevision parameter is specified, otherwise it is 'Live'.

"SpecificRevision": The specivic revision to execute, when RevisionSelection is set to 'Specific'

requests.name: GetContentDownloadUrl
requests.description:
This API retrieves a pre-signed URL for accessing a content file for the title. A subsequent HTTP GET to the returned URL will attempt to download the content. A HEAD query to the returned URL will attempt to retrieve the metadata of the content. Note that a successful result does not guarantee the existence of this content - if it has not been uploaded, the query to retrieve the data will fail. See this post for more information: https://community.playfab.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/205469488-How-to-upload-files-to-PlayFab-s-Content-Service. Also, please be aware that the Content service is specifically PlayFab's CDN offering, for which standard CDN rates apply.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/GetContentDownloadUrl

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"HttpMethod": HTTP method to fetch item - GET or HEAD. Use HEAD when only fetching metadata. Default is GET.

"Key": Key of the content item to fetch, usually formatted as a path, e.g. images/a.png

"ThruCDN": True to download through CDN. CDN provides higher download bandwidth and lower latency. However, if you want the latest, non-cached version of the content during development, set this to false. Default is true.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: GetFriendLeaderboard
requests.description:
Retrieves a list of ranked friends of the current player for the given statistic, starting from the indicated point in the leaderboard

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/GetFriendLeaderboard

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"IncludeFacebookFriends": Indicates whether Facebook friends should be included in the response. Default is true.

"IncludeSteamFriends": Indicates whether Steam service friends should be included in the response. Default is true.

"MaxResultsCount": Maximum number of entries to retrieve. Default 10, maximum 100.

"ProfileConstraints": If non-null, this determines which properties of the resulting player profiles to return. For API calls from the client, only the allowed client profile properties for the title may be requested. These allowed properties are configured in the Game Manager "Client Profile Options" tab in the "Settings" section.

"StartPosition": Position in the leaderboard to start this listing (defaults to the first entry).

"StatisticName": Statistic used to rank friends for this leaderboard.

"Version": The version of the leaderboard to get.

"XboxToken": Xbox token if Xbox friends should be included. Requires Xbox be configured on PlayFab.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

"MaxResultsCount": Maximum number of entries to retrieve. Default 10, maximum 100.

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Keys":  array of keys to get back data from the Publisher data blob, set by the admin tools

requests.name: GetSharedGroupData
requests.description:
Retrieves data stored in a shared group object, as well as the list of members in the group. Non-members of the group may use this to retrieve group data, including membership, but they will not receive data for keys marked as private. Shared Groups are designed for sharing data between a very small number of players, please see our guide: https://api.playfab.com/docs/tutorials/landing-players/shared-groups

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/GetSharedGroupData

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"GetMembers": If true, return the list of all members of the shared group.

"Keys": Specific keys to retrieve from the shared group (if not specified, all keys will be returned, while an empty array indicates that no keys should be returned).

"SharedGroupId": Unique identifier for the shared group.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: LoginWithAndroidDeviceID
requests.description:
Signs the user in using the Android device identifier, returning a session identifier that can subsequently be used for API calls which require an authenticated user

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/LoginWithAndroidDeviceID

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"AndroidDevice": Specific model of the user's device.

"AndroidDeviceId": Android device identifier for the user's device.

"CreateAccount": Automatically create a PlayFab account if one is not currently linked to this ID.

"EncryptedRequest": Base64 encoded body that is encrypted with the Title's public RSA key (Enterprise Only).

"InfoRequestParameters": Flags for which pieces of info to return for the user.

"LoginTitlePlayerAccountEntity": Flag to automatically login the player's title_player_account and return the associated entity token.

"OS": Specific Operating System version for the user's device.

"PlayerSecret": Player secret that is used to verify API request signatures (Enterprise Only).

"TitleId": Unique identifier for the title, found in the Settings > Game Properties section of the PlayFab developer site when a title has been selected.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: LoginWithWindowsHello
requests.description:
Completes the Windows Hello login flow by returning the signed value of the challange from GetWindowsHelloChallenge. Windows Hello has a 2 step client to server authentication scheme. Step one is to request from the server a challenge string. Step two is to request the user sign the string via Windows Hello and then send the signed value back to the server. 

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/LoginWithWindowsHello

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"ChallengeSignature": The signed response from the user for the Challenge.

"InfoRequestParameters": Flags for which pieces of info to return for the user.

"LoginTitlePlayerAccountEntity": Flag to automatically login the player's title_player_account and return the associated entity token.

"PublicKeyHint": SHA256 hash of the PublicKey generated by Windows Hello.

"TitleId": Unique identifier for the title, found in the Settings > Game Properties section of the PlayFab developer site when a title has been selected.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: Matchmake
requests.description:
Attempts to locate a game session matching the given parameters. If the goal is to match the player into a specific active session, only the LobbyId is required. Otherwise, the BuildVersion, GameMode, and Region are all required parameters. Note that parameters specified in the search are required (they are not weighting factors). If a slot is found in a server instance matching the parameters, the slot will be assigned to that player, removing it from the availabe set. In that case, the information on the game session will be returned, otherwise the Status returned will be GameNotFound.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/Matchmake

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"BuildVersion": Build version to match against. [Note: Required if LobbyId is not specified]

"CharacterId": Character to use for stats based matching. Leave null to use account stats.

"GameMode": Game mode to match make against. [Note: Required if LobbyId is not specified]

"LobbyId": Lobby identifier to match make against. This is used to select a specific Game Server Instance.

"Region": Region to match make against. [Note: Required if LobbyId is not specified]

"StartNewIfNoneFound": Start a game session if one with an open slot is not found. Defaults to true.

"StatisticName": Player statistic to use in finding a match. May be null for no stat-based matching.

"TagFilter": Filter to include and/or exclude Game Server Instances associated with certain Tags

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"AllowedPlayerIds": Players who are allowed to accept the trade. If null, the trade may be accepted by any player. If empty, the trade may not be accepted by any player.

"OfferedInventoryInstanceIds": Player inventory items offered for trade. If not set, the trade is effectively a gift request

"RequestedCatalogItemIds": Catalog items accepted for the trade. If not set, the trade is effectively a gift.

requests.name: PurchaseItem
requests.description:
Buys a single item with virtual currency. You must specify both the virtual currency to use to purchase, as well as what the client believes the price to be. This lets the server fail the purchase if the price has changed.

"CatalogVersion": Catalog version for the items to be purchased (defaults to most recent version.

"CharacterId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

"ItemId": Unique identifier of the item to purchase.

"Price": Price the client expects to pay for the item (in case a new catalog or store was uploaded, with new prices).

requests.name: RegisterPlayFabUser
requests.description:

"Email": User email address attached to their account

"EncryptedRequest": Base64 encoded body that is encrypted with the Title's public RSA key (Enterprise Only).

"InfoRequestParameters": Flags for which pieces of info to return for the user.

"LoginTitlePlayerAccountEntity": Flag to automatically login the player's title_player_account and return the associated entity token.

"Password": Password for the PlayFab account (6-100 characters)

"PlayerSecret": Player secret that is used to verify API request signatures (Enterprise Only).

"RequireBothUsernameAndEmail": An optional parameter that specifies whether both the username and email parameters are required. If true, both parameters are required; if false, the user must supply either the username or email parameter. The default value is true.

"TitleId": Unique identifier for the title, found in the Settings > Game Properties section of the PlayFab developer site when a title has been selected.

"Username": PlayFab username for the account (3-20 characters)

requests.name: UnlockContainerInstance
requests.description:

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"CatalogVersion": Specifies the catalog version that should be used to determine container contents. If unspecified, uses catalog associated with the item instance.

requests.name: UpdateSharedGroupData
requests.description:
Adds, updates, and removes data keys for a shared group object. If the permission is set to Public, all fields updated or added in this call will be readable by users not in the group. By default, data permissions are set to Private. Regardless of the permission setting, only members of the group can update the data. Shared Groups are designed for sharing data between a very small number of players, please see our guide: https://api.playfab.com/docs/tutorials/landing-players/shared-groups

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Client/method/UpdateSharedGroupData

"Data": Key-value pairs to be written to the custom data. Note that keys are trimmed of whitespace, are limited in size, and may not begin with a '!' character or be null.

"KeysToRemove": Optional list of Data-keys to remove from UserData. Some SDKs cannot insert null-values into Data due to language constraints. Use this to delete the keys directly.

"Permission": Permission to be applied to all user data keys in this request.

"SharedGroupId": Unique identifier for the shared group.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Data": Key-value pairs to be written to the custom data. Note that keys are trimmed of whitespace, are limited in size, and may not begin with a '!' character or be null.

"KeysToRemove": Optional list of Data-keys to remove from UserData. Some SDKs cannot insert null-values into Data due to language constraints. Use this to delete the keys directly.

"Permission": Permission to be applied to all user data keys written in this request. Defaults to "private" if not set. This is used for requests by one player for information about another player; those requests will only return Public keys.

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"SessionTicket" - The string returned as "SessionTicket" in response to any Login API.

"Body": Custom event properties. Each property consists of a name (string) and a value (JSON object).

"EventName": The name of the event, within the namespace scoped to the title. The naming convention is up to the caller, but it commonly follows the subject_verb_object pattern (e.g. player_logged_in).

"Timestamp": The time (in UTC) associated with this event. The value dafaults to the current time.

requests.name: StartGame
requests.description:

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Matchmaker/method/StartGame

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Build": Unique identifier of the previously uploaded build executable which is to be started.

"CustomCommandLineData": Custom command line argument when starting game server process.

"ExternalMatchmakerEventEndpoint": HTTP endpoint URL for receiving game status events, if using an external matchmaker. When the game ends, PlayFab will make a POST request to this URL with the X-SecretKey header set to the value of the game's secret and an application/json body of { "EventName": "game_ended", "GameID": "<gameid>" }.

"GameMode": Game mode for this Game Server Instance.

"Region": Region with which to associate the server, for filtering.

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"FunctionName": The name of the CloudScript function to execute

"FunctionParameter": Object that is passed in to the function as the first argument

"GeneratePlayStreamEvent": Generate a 'player_executed_cloudscript' PlayStream event containing the results of the function execution and other contextual information. This event will show up in the PlayStream debugger console for the player in Game Manager.

"PlayFabId": The unique user identifier for the player on whose behalf the script is being run

"RevisionSelection": Option for which revision of the CloudScript to execute. 'Latest' executes the most recently created revision, 'Live' executes the current live, published revision, and 'Specific' executes the specified revision. The default value is 'Specific', if the SpeificRevision parameter is specified, otherwise it is 'Live'.

"SpecificRevision": The specivic revision to execute, when RevisionSelection is set to 'Specific'

requests.name: GetContentDownloadUrl
requests.description:
This API retrieves a pre-signed URL for accessing a content file for the title. A subsequent HTTP GET to the returned URL will attempt to download the content. A HEAD query to the returned URL will attempt to retrieve the metadata of the content. Note that a successful result does not guarantee the existence of this content - if it has not been uploaded, the query to retrieve the data will fail. See this post for more information: https://community.playfab.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/205469488-How-to-upload-files-to-PlayFab-s-Content-Service. Also, please be aware that the Content service is specifically PlayFab's CDN offering, for which standard CDN rates apply.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/GetContentDownloadUrl

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"HttpMethod": HTTP method to fetch item - GET or HEAD. Use HEAD when only fetching metadata. Default is GET.

"Key": Key of the content item to fetch, usually formatted as a path, e.g. images/a.png

"ThruCDN": True to download through CDN. CDN provides higher download bandwidth and lower latency. However, if you want the latest, non-cached version of the content during development, set this to false. Default is true.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

"IncludeFacebookFriends": Indicates whether Facebook friends should be included in the response. Default is true.

"IncludeSteamFriends": Indicates whether Steam service friends should be included in the response. Default is true.

"MaxResultsCount": Maximum number of entries to retrieve.

"PlayFabId": The player whose friend leaderboard to get

"ProfileConstraints": If non-null, this determines which properties of the resulting player profiles to return. For API calls from the client, only the allowed client profile properties for the title may be requested. These allowed properties are configured in the Game Manager "Client Profile Options" tab in the "Settings" section.

"StartPosition": Position in the leaderboard to start this listing (defaults to the first entry).

"StatisticName": Statistic used to rank friends for this leaderboard.

"Version": The version of the leaderboard to get.

"XboxToken": Xbox token if Xbox friends should be included. Requires Xbox be configured on PlayFab.

requests.description:
Retrieves a list of ranked users for the given statistic, starting from the indicated point in the leaderboard

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/GetLeaderboard

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"MaxResultsCount": Maximum number of entries to retrieve.

"ProfileConstraints": If non-null, this determines which properties of the resulting player profiles to return. For API calls from the client, only the allowed client profile properties for the title may be requested. These allowed properties are configured in the Game Manager "Client Profile Options" tab in the "Settings" section.

"StartPosition": First entry in the leaderboard to be retrieved.

"StatisticName": Unique identifier for the title-specific statistic for the leaderboard.

"Version": The version of the leaderboard to get.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: GetPlayersInSegment
requests.description:
Allows for paging through all players in a given segment. This API creates a snapshot of all player profiles that match the segment definition at the time of its creation and lives through the Total Seconds to Live, refreshing its life span on each subsequent use of the Continuation Token. Profiles that change during the course of paging will not be reflected in the results. AB Test segments are currently not supported by this operation.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/GetPlayersInSegment

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"ContinuationToken": Continuation token if retrieving subsequent pages of results.

"MaxBatchSize": Maximum number of profiles to load. Default is 1,000. Maximum is 10,000.

"SecondsToLive": Number of seconds to keep the continuation token active. After token expiration it is not possible to continue paging results. Default is 300 (5 minutes). Maximum is 1,800 (30 minutes).

"SegmentId": Unique identifier for this segment.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: RegisterGame
requests.description:
Inform the matchmaker that a new Game Server Instance is added.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/RegisterGame

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Build": Unique identifier of the build running on the Game Server Instance.

"GameMode": Game Mode the Game Server instance is running. Note that this must be defined in the Game Modes tab in the PlayFab Game Manager, along with the Build ID (the same Game Mode can be defined for multiple Build IDs).

"LobbyId": Previous lobby id if re-registering an existing game.

"Region": Region in which the Game Server Instance is running. For matchmaking using non-AWS region names, set this to any AWS region and use Tags (below) to specify your custom region.

"ServerHost": IPV4 address of the Game Server Instance.

"ServerIPV6Address": IPV6 address of the Game Server Instance.

"ServerPort": Port number for communication with the Game Server Instance.

"Tags": Tags for the Game Server Instance

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". requests.name: SendPushNotification
requests.description:
Sends an iOS/Android Push Notification to a specific user, if that user's device has been configured for Push Notifications in PlayFab. If a user has linked both Android and iOS devices, both will be notified.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/SendPushNotification

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"AdvancedPlatformDelivery": Allows you to provide precisely formatted json to target devices. This is an advanced feature, allowing you to deliver to custom plugin logic, fields, or functionality not natively supported by PlayFab.

"Message": Text of message to send.

"Package": Defines all possible push attributes like message, title, icon, etc. Some parameters are device specific - please see the PushNotificationPackage documentation for details.

"Recipient": PlayFabId of the recipient of the push notification.

"Subject": Subject of message to send (may not be displayed in all platforms)

"TargetPlatforms": Target Platforms that should receive the Message or Package. If omitted, we will send to all available platforms.

requests.name: UnlockContainerInstance
requests.description:
Opens a specific container (ContainerItemInstanceId), with a specific key (KeyItemInstanceId, when required), and returns the contents of the opened container. If the container (and key when relevant) are consumable (RemainingUses > 0), their RemainingUses will be decremented, consistent with the operation of ConsumeItem.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/UnlockContainerInstance

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"CatalogVersion": Specifies the catalog version that should be used to determine container contents. If unspecified, uses catalog associated with the item instance.

"CharacterId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

"ContainerItemInstanceId": ItemInstanceId of the container to unlock.

"KeyItemInstanceId": ItemInstanceId of the key that will be consumed by unlocking this container. If the container requires a key, this parameter is required.

"PlayFabId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: UnlockContainerItem
requests.description:
Searches Player or Character inventory for any ItemInstance matching the given CatalogItemId, if necessary unlocks it using any appropriate key, and returns the contents of the opened container. If the container (and key when relevant) are consumable (RemainingUses > 0), their RemainingUses will be decremented, consistent with the operation of ConsumeItem.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/UnlockContainerItem

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"CatalogVersion": Specifies the catalog version that should be used to determine container contents. If unspecified, uses default/primary catalog.

"CharacterId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

"ContainerItemId": Catalog ItemId of the container type to unlock.

"PlayFabId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

requests.name: UpdateSharedGroupData
requests.description:
Adds, updates, and removes data keys for a shared group object. If the permission is set to Public, all fields updated or added in this call will be readable by users not in the group. By default, data permissions are set to Private. Regardless of the permission setting, only members of the group (and the server) can update the data. Shared Groups are designed for sharing data between a very small number of players, please see our guide: https://api.playfab.com/docs/tutorials/landing-players/shared-groups

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/UpdateSharedGroupData

"Data": Key-value pairs to be written to the custom data. Note that keys are trimmed of whitespace, are limited in size, and may not begin with a '!' character or be null.

"KeysToRemove": Optional list of Data-keys to remove from UserData. Some SDKs cannot insert null-values into Data due to language constraints. Use this to delete the keys directly.

"Permission": Permission to be applied to all user data keys in this request.

"SharedGroupId": Unique identifier for the shared group.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.

requests.name: WriteCharacterEvent
requests.description:
Writes a character-based event into PlayStream.

Api Documentation: https://api.playfab.com/Documentation/Server/method/WriteCharacterEvent

**The following case-sensitive environment variables are required for this call:**

"TitleId" - The Title Id of your game, available in the Game Manager (https://developer.playfab.com)

"SecretKey" - The PlayFab API Secret Key, available in Game Manager for your title (https://developer.playfab.com/en-us/{{titleId}}/settings/credentials)

**The body of this api-call should be proper json-format.  The api-body accepts the following case-sensitive parameters:**

"Body": Custom event properties. Each property consists of a name (string) and a value (JSON object).

"CharacterId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

"EventName": The name of the event, within the namespace scoped to the title. The naming convention is up to the caller, but it commonly follows the subject_verb_object pattern (e.g. player_logged_in).

"PlayFabId": Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

"Timestamp": The time (in UTC) associated with this event. The value dafaults to the current time.

To set up an Environment, click the text next to the eye icon up top in Postman (it should say "No environment", if this is your first time using Postman). Select "Manage environments", then "Add". Type a name for your environment where it says "New environment", then enter each variable name above as the "Key", with the value as defined for each above.
